fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Visible fields are configurable on create/edit issue screen from _Configure Fields > Custom_ dropdown.
However, the settings don't persist in the following situation.

# Associate an issue type (e.g. "Task") in a project and it's create/edit issue operation with a screen which contains a custom field whose name is "test"
# Associate another issue type (e.g. "Bug") in the project and it's create/edit issue operation with another screen which *doesn't* contain "test" field
# Navigate to an issue page in the project
# Open create/edit issue dialog
# Set issue type as "Task"
# Navigate to _Configure Fields > Custom_ and set "test" field visible and confirm if the field is shown as expected
 !image-2018-09-10-10-41-19-239.png|thumbnail! 
# Change the issue type to "Bug" and confirm if "test" field turns out to be invisible as the field is not in the screen configuration
 !image-2018-09-10-10-45-01-870.png|thumbnail!
# Navigate to _Configure Fields > Custom_ and tick/untick some field other than "test" field
# Change the issue type back to "Task" and now "test" field is still invisible even though we never touched "test" field configuration
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The field visibility does't persist between Step 6 and Step 9 because the change in Step 8 overwrites it.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nicer if Jira could use the following strategy when updating the field visibilities.

# In case that the field is never touched in _Configure Fields > Custom_ dropdown, just leave the visibility as it is
# In case that the field is ticked/unticked in _Configure Fields > Custom_ dropdown, update the visibility with following the change
fields.summary: Field Configurations on create/edit issue screen don't persist after changing issue type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we have an Epic that is configured with a different Security Level from the issues linked to this Epic and the Kanban board filter is set to use the same Security Level as the issues linked to this Epic, the issues will not be shown at the Kanban Board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic and set to use a security level "A"
# Link some issues to this Epic but set the security level to "B"
# Create a Kanban Board
# Set the Kanban board filter to something like {{project = TEST AND (level in (B) OR assignee = admin) ORDER BY Rank ASC}}
# You'll notice that the issues linked to the board are not displayed even if they're in the same security level as configured in the board filter
 
h3. Expected Results
The issues should be displayed as expected because they are in the same security level as the board filter

h3. Actual Results
No issues are displayed in the Kanban board
 
h3.Workaround
We can change the swimlanes to be based on another type other than "Epic"

# Go to the board affected
# Click on Board > Configure > Swimlanes
# Change to another type of swimlane (don't use Epic)
fields.summary: Epic security level prevent issue to be displayed on a Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When JIRA is started with a user who does not own the folder where JIRA's files are located, following error will be thrown at startup:

{code}
/opt/atlassian/jira/bin/setenv.sh: line 104: cd: /home/tonystark: Permission denied
{code}

+Steps to reproduce+

# Install JIRA with a user (Eg: steverodgers).
# All the folder related to JIRA (Install & Home) will belong to the steverodgers.
# Start JIRA with tonystark user and the error above will be shown.


h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the warning message to say that the user used to start JIRA does not have sufficient permission to JIRA's directories.


h3. Workaround 

Start JIRA with the user which owns both JIRA's installation and home directory.
fields.summary: Misleading error when starting JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA keeps resizing when you move the mouse over the Time field when you use the Calendar of any date time Picker field, causing an annoying bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Date Time Picker custom field and add it to the create issue screen of any project
 * Change on your *profile* the JIRA Language to *Deutsch*
 * Click to create a new issue using the project you added the custom field
 * In the create issue Screen, Click in the Calendar at the right side of the field and move your mouse over the time field

h3. Expected Results

The Calendar keeps in the same size and you should be able to change the time.
h3. Actual Results

Due to the notes returned below the calendar, the calendar resizes and keep doing it until you click at the time. (Check attached GIF)
h3. Workaround

Click in the resized time stops the bug.
fields.summary: JIRA Date-time picker calendar resizing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Jira administrator I want to see on the audit log interface when a user changes the statuses by getting through Administration > Issues > Issue Attributes > Statuses

h3. Suggested Solution
Add this entry to the logs sent to the audit log.

h3. Why this is important
This change affects all projects. 
This change can be changed by mistake and we would like to identify who did it.
 
h3. Workaround 
* It is important to limit the number of users having the global permission "Jira administrators permission".
* Enabling SQL Logging can reveal the user who did the changes. However, this has a significant performance impact.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68044].
{panel}
fields.summary: Audit log does not show *Issue Attributes > Statuses* change

fields.description:
h4. Request Description

In regards to clickjacking protection, Jira supports an _all or nothing_ approach.
 You can have it enabled for the full site, disable it for selected pages or disable it for the entire site.

When gadgets are not available for certain functionalities, the option to load Jira content in Confluence is by using the HTML Macro together with an iFrame.
This is also true when customers need to include Jira pages within an iFrame in their own applications.

For some customers, completely disabling the security headers in Jira may not be an option, even for specific pages.
 While browsers support an option on which you can configure specific target sites to load content in an iFrame, Jira doesn't provide a configuration for it.
h4. Current Scenario

As described in JRASERVER-25143 and in [Security headers in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/security-headers-in-jira-939919914.html], Jira uses the following response headers related to [Clickjacking|https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Clickjacking]:
||Header||Value||
|X-Frame-Options|SAMEORIGIN|
|Content-Security-Policy|frame-ancestors 'self'|

As explained in [Security headers in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/security-headers-in-jira-939919914.html], using JVM arguments we can completely disable these headers for specific pages or for the entire site.
h4. Expected Scenario

In addition to the _current scenario_, Jira should have a configuration to allow access to the entire site for specific target applications while preventing the access to any other.
 This can be achieved by providing a list of allowed sites using the following response headers:
 * [{{ALLOW-FROM}} directive|https://www.keycdn.com/blog/x-frame-options/#3-ALLOW-FROM-uriDirective].
 * [{{Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors}}|https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet#Preventing_Clickjacking].

Both directives may be required because of different browser compatibility:
 * [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Frame-Options#Browser_compatibility]
 * [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/frame-ancestors#Browser_compatibility]

h4. Workaround
If using a reverse proxy, modify the response headers with the clickjacking directives highlighted above.
h4. Changes on Nginx configuration
The goal with this Nginx change is to modify the [CSP: frame-ancestors|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/frame-ancestors] response header sent from Jira, allowing specific services to load a Jira page within an iFrame.

By default, Jira sends the following response header for all requests:
{code}
Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self';
{code}
\\

What we need to do from Nginx is to remove this response header and send a new one with the changes we need.
\\

To remove the default response header, the following [directive|http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_proxy_module.html#proxy_hide_header] can be used.
{code}
proxy_hide_header Content-Security-Policy;
{code}

To add the header with the needed configuration, the following [directive|http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_headers_module.html#add_header] should be used.
{code}
add_header Content-Security-Policy "frame-ancestors 'self' <external-service-URL>" always;
{code}
{{<external-service-URL>}} should be replaced using the standard defined for {{host-source}} in [this link|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/frame-ancestors].
\\

Both of the above configuration should be added within the {{location}} directive related to Jira in the Nginx config file.
fields.summary: Enhancement on the clickjacking response headers for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we don't store every single login event for users. 
While we do store the last login time, this data in the *cwd_user_attributes* table may be inaccurate because of JRASERVER-60508
h3. Suggested Solution
Create login events table that would have a new line added every time a user logs in or out.
This table will be updated every time the user's session expires and a new session is created even if there *Remember me* option is checked. 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Add a login/logout audit table

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Project ID Variable does not work for webhook event Link created.,

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook for events 'Issue Updated' and 'Link Created'
# Make sure you append variable (Eg: project id) to the URL
# Fire webhook for both events
# Check logs for posting on webhook

h3. Expected Results

Posting URL has project id appended

h3. Actual Results

Posting URL does not have project id appended

h3.Workaround
As per, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68086 it's possible to add some CSS to Jira's announcement banner to make the variables clearer:
 
{code:java}
<style type="text/css">
.webhooks .variable-intersection { font-weight: bold; color: #36B37E !important; }
.webhooks .variable-some { font-weight: bold; color: #FFAB00 !important; }
</style>
{code}
Please ensure you test this change in a test environment first, before applying to production. If you see [unusual behaviour in pages after applying this fix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-pages-go-hidden-or-blank-after-adding-an-announcement-banner-396298891.html], you may need to remove the adjustments - we also have steps to [remove the announcement banner through the database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-jira-announcement-banner-through-the-database-429916703.html].
fields.summary: Webhook Variables do not work for webhook event Link created

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upon trying to click on the View Issues link in the project statistics page, JIRA throws a null pointer exception and the issues fail to load. 
This happens with any kind of project, Software or Business projects.


h3. Environment
*  JIRA 7.12.0 is installed and a project with at least 1 issue is created.
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.12.0
# Create a business project management project.
# Create 1 issue under that project and don't close it.
# Navigate to the project summary page (click on the project name to go to the summary page)
# switch the view from Activity (default) to Statistics
# On the statistics page, click on *View Issues* under Unresolved: By Assignee.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will open the issue navigator page and will display the issues unresolved by Assignee 

h3. Actual Results
JIRA fails to display the page and a 500 error is produced to the customer:
{noformat}
2018-09-05 11:44:13,580 http-nio-17120-exec-21 ERROR sherif 704x1475x1 aqz5j1 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /issues/ [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/jira7120].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet [action] threw exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.JqlHelper.lambda$static$11(JqlHelper.java:88)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.visitors.SingleValueChecker.visit(SingleValueChecker.java:10)
        at com.atlassian.query.operand.SingleValueOperand.accept(SingleValueOperand.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.checker.ClauseChecker.lambda$expectOperand$4(ClauseChecker.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.checker.ClauseChecker.lambda$and$8(ClauseChecker.java:70)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.checker.ClauseChecker.lambda$and$8(ClauseChecker.java:70)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.checker.ClauseChecker.lambda$build$9(ClauseChecker.java:95)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.JqlHelper$3.lambda$visit$0(JqlHelper.java:198)
        at java.util.stream.MatchOps$1MatchSink.accept(MatchOps.java:90)
        at java.util.Spliterators$IteratorSpliterator.tryAdvance(Spliterators.java:1812)
        at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEachWithCancel(ReferencePipeline.java:126)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyIntoWithCancel(AbstractPipeline.java:498)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:485)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
        at java.util.stream.MatchOps$MatchOp.evaluateSequential(MatchOps.java:230)
        at java.util.stream.MatchOps$MatchOp.evaluateSequential(MatchOps.java:196)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.anyMatch(ReferencePipeline.java:449)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.JqlHelper$3.visit(JqlHelper.java:198)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.JqlHelper$3.visit(JqlHelper.java:194)
        at com.atlassian.query.clause.TerminalClauseImpl.accept(TerminalClauseImpl.java:143)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.issuenavigator.searcher.JqlHelper$3.lambda$doVisit$1(JqlHelper.java:210)
        at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$7$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:267)
        at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1382)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
        at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* On statistics page,  *View Issues* under *Unresolved: By Assignee* links to:
 http://localhost:17120/jira7120/issues/?jql=project+%3D+10000+AND+resolution+%3D+Unresolved+ORDER+BY+assignee+ASC%2C+priority+DESC%2C+key+ASC&mode=hide
All other statistics also fail like: *Unresolved: By Component*, *Unresolved: By Priority*, *Unresolved: By Issue Type*.
Only *Status Summary* works, and it is noticed that Status Summary* uses the project key rather than the numeric project id.
All the links work on JIRA 7.11. with exception of  *Unresolved: By Priority*, which have a JQL bug, with a redundant priority in the query, but still, the issue navigator works fine and loads with no problem in JIRA 7.11.

* If we change the project id number to the Project key, the URL works and issue navigator is shown.

* *This also occurs* when trying to drill down on issues from the *pie chart* available on Dashboards.



h3.Workaround
Need to create a custom set of filters that will return similar results and avoid using the links in the project statistics page.

fields.description:
Currently Jira uses the default allocation of the CodeCache memory pool of 256mb.

In larger environments Jira can exhaust this memory pool which causes performance degradation as described in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-crashes-due-to-codecache-is-full-compiler-has-been-disabled-314447083.html]

Additionally, increasing CodeCache to 384mb is part of Premier Support's Jira healthcheck.

This request is for Jira to ship with the following JVM argument by default which increased CodeCache to 384m:
{code}
-XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=384m
{code}
fields.summary: Ship Jira with increased CodeCache size

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira currently has the ability to search for issues that contain components with certain users as Component Leads, per [Advanced searching - functions reference : componentsLeadByUser()|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/advanced-searching-functions-reference-939937722.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-componentsLeadByUsercomponentsLeadByUser()]

Per the above reference, the *componentsLeadByUser* accepts a username as a parameter to identify issues which are part of components where the user in question is the component lead. Additionally, it can be left blank to instead use the current user as the component lead.

(!) At this time, there is no ability to supply a *NULL* or *empty* parameter to identify issues which are part of a component with *no component lead*. Admins will find this handy should they ever need to identify this population of issues.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a new function, or extend the current *componentsLeadByUser* to accept a *NULL* or *empty* type parameter in order to match against components which have no lead.

h3. Why this is important
 
For a system which uses components regularly as part of the system's regular workflow, components which have no lead (and the issues in those components) becomes a point of interest for admins. Jira currently offers no way to bulk identify these components, and by extension, no way to identify issues which are in these components.

h3. Workaround 

Identify all components with no lead directly from the database:
* {{select * from component where LEAD is NULL;}}

The results can be used as arguments in JQL to find these issues manually.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to search for issues in components with no component lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira's Java API for issue create and issue edit executes code that is database transaction unfriendly. This code is about setting label custom field values. During this operation we reset cache storing label values and expect the new ones to be already present in database for loading. Any other thread that will access the cache for created/edited issue during the transaction will load the data without uncommitted part.

h3. Steps to reproduce

{panel:title=Notice}
Steps to reproduce include 3rd party apps that show example of Jira API usage that causes the problem. If you are aware of this behaviour causing problem in Jira without 3rd party apps please let us know in issue comment.
{panel}

 # Setup Jira 7.10.1
 # Install [Exocet 2.15.1|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211111/exocet-copy-link-and-sync-jira-issues/version-history]
 # Install [Automation for Jira 3.13.10|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira/version-history]
 # Setup 2 projects: "Project A" and "Project B"
 # [Setup a custom field of type "Labels" globally|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-field-938847222.html]
 # Configure Exocet field mappings to copy this "Labels" custom field:
 ## Go to "Administration" -> "Add-ons" -> "Exocet" -> "Configuration"
 ## Switch tab to "Fields mapping".
 ## Click "+Add" button.
 ## Set "Name" field and add "Field to field" for copying "Labels" custom field created earlier.
 ## Click "Save" button.
 # Configure an Exocet operation to create a new issue in "Project B":
 ## Go to "Administration" -> "Add-ons" -> "Exocet" -> "Configuration"
 ## In tab "Operations" click "+Add" button.
 ## Set "Name" field
 ## In tab "Target" of "Create a operation":
 ### Set "Project" to "Project B".
 ### Set "Issue type" and "Link" fields to any available option.
 ### Set "Fields mapping" to one created earlier.
 # [Add configured Exocet operation as a post-function in any workflow transition for "Project A"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/advanced-workflow-configuration-938847443.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-postfunctionsPostfunctions]
 # Configure an Automation for Jira rule triggered by an issue event:
 ## Go to "Administration" -> "System" -> "Automation for Jira" -> "Automation rules"
 ## Click "Create rule" button.
 ## As a trigger pick "Issue commented"
 ## Select "New action" -> "Log action".
 ## Type anything into "Log message" and click "Save" button.
 ## Set anything in "Name your automation..." field and click "Turn it on".
 # Create issue "Issue A" in "Project A" with values in "Labels" custom field.
 # Transition "Issue A" in "Project A" using the transition you added the Exocet post-function to.

h4. Expected result
A new issue is created in "Project B" with all of labels from copied issue.

h4.  Actual result
A new issue is created in "Project B", however the labels custom field appears to not have any values.
fields.summary: Wrong data can be cached in Jira while in post function creating issue or changing label custom field value

fields.description:
h5. Description

The bold markup will not render correctly (in visual editor or comments) when it's part of another word.
h5. Steps to replicate

Add wiki markup to an existing word mid way through the word (for example, the "es" in "test".
h5. Expected results

The "es" is bolded.
h5. Actual results

The "es" is not bolded.
h5. Workaround

Insert a tag like {{color}} into the markup.
h5. Test cases:
{code:java}
*test*
t*es*t
t{color}*es*{color}t
{code}
Produces:
 *test* (/)
 t*es*t (x)
t{color}*es*{color}t (/)
fields.summary: Wiki Markup - Bold Text doesn't render mid way through a word

fields.description:
Hello!
I am trying to install Git integration plugin for Jira.
All requirements for this plugin is OK. See the screenshots.
What should I do in this case? I need this plugin critically.
fields.summary: Git integration isn't showing in plugin manager

fields.description:
The custom fields page is updated in Jira 7.12 and now custom fields are listed in a paged structure. A search feature is included but it searches only through custom field names.

It is quite common for an admin to search for custom fields of a specific type so the search feature should also look into custom field type names.
fields.summary: Custom Fields page search feature should include type information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, you can define a list of Bamboo application under Bamboo configuration page in JIRA to the corresponding project you would like to linked with, however all our Bamboo application links get connected in every project in JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Only linked the Bamboo build to the  corresponding JIRA project
fields.summary: JIRA does not filter Bamboo builds to the corresponding project configured in the Bamboo configuration page

fields.description:
Right now the two ways to create an issue filter are:
 # Create a search and save it as a filter
 # Copy another filter and replace/modify the JQL and other characteristics

This request seeks to have filter creation as a first class citizen: click a button, the empty form comes up and JQL and other elements can be entered and then saved as a new filter.
fields.summary: Create Filter From Scratch Flow

fields.description: Currently a user can be enumerated by typing \[~johndoe\], where the username is known.
fields.summary: Do not allow users without browse user permissions to enumerate using [~] when the username is known

fields.description:
h3. Description of problem

When Java API doc for Jira is released, it doesn't appear to be updating [https://docs.atlassian.com|https://docs.atlassian.com/]
h3. Example
 * Clicking on the jira -> latest link ([https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/latest]) will take you to the JIRA 7.6.1 API ([https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.6.1/])
 * Java API links for versions of JIRA later than 7.6.1 are not listed on the menu

Other Java API versions are available if you know the links, however you have to know they're there: 
 eg [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.12.0/]
h3. Workaround

Use the below Links

[7.7.0|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.7.0/]
[7.8.0|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.8.0/]
[7.9.0|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.9.0/]
[7.10.0|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.10.0/]
[7.11.0|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.11.0/]
[7.12.0|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.12.0/]
fields.summary: JIRA Java API docs no longer being updated to the menu on docs.atlassian.com

In Jira Cloud, it is possible to [create an API token|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html] for authentication.

In Jira Server, only Basic and OAuth are available.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62865].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there are two way for importing issues:
 # Import issues from CSV (for all the users)
 # External system import

In first option which is widely used by all the users in JIRA, Watchers is not available in the drop-down mapping field
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Mapping of Watchers for Import issues from CSV (for all the users) as we cannot provide administrator right to all the user to perform external system import(*JIRA Administration > system > external system import > CSV*).
fields.summary: Allow Mapping of Watchers for Import issues from CSV (for all the users)

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When Jira is built and ran from source (mvn install + ./jmake debug) and accessed through IE 11 some web resources do not load which results in pages and components failing to load.

Some of the pages are: System Dashboard or Project config summary (plugins/servlet/project-config/JRASERVER/summary).

Some of the resources that fail to load are: Calendar.js, jira/moment, jira/skate, jira/projects/util/browser.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Execute 'mvn clean install -DskipTests' in Jira Core repo.
 # Execute './jmake debug -sh -sw AUTO' when Jira is built.
 # Access Jira in IE 11 (default is [http://localhost:8090/jira).]
 # Go to System Dashboard or Project config summary page.

Having followed these steps, the bug was reproduced in 7.6.0, 7.11.1, 7.13.0 but did not reproduce in 7.2.4. It also did not reproduce in standalone instances of affected versions (even with disabled web resource batching).
h2. Expected results

Resources (.js flies, libraries) are loaded timely and pages render with no visual glitches.
h2. Actual results

!Screen Shot 2018-08-29 at 13.32.46.png|width=1327,height=715!  
h2. Workaround

 None (other than switching to a different browser)
fields.summary: Pages do not fully load in built from source Jira in IE 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When some issue that is about to appear in Activity Stream gadget has a lot of comments (e.g. 200) made after creation of a lot of history entries (e.g. 15000), the loading time can be too high for the gadget to display the results. The timeout for loading gadget data is unmodifiable and is set at 10 seconds.

The problem exists because of current way of calculating issue summary for comment is inefficient. It scales defined as number of comments times number of history entries before given comment was made.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Setup Jira with some issues containing 15000 entries in history tab
 # Make 200 comments in the issue.
 # Load Activity Stream gadget

Or you can use prepared backup for Jira 7.2.15:  [^JRASERVER-67865-reproduction-backup.zip]
(user: admin / password: admin)
Note: the backup is different than result of steps from above.

h4. Expected result

Activity Stream loads with recent comment
h4. Actual result

Activity Stream fails to load with message:
{quote}The activity source for 'JIRA' was slow to respond and isn't included.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

If you know which issue is causing the problem you can use [Activity Stream gadgets' filters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/activity-stream-gadget-218275789.html]

h3. Notes
Activity Stream has safety mechanism that prevents instance from being flooded by Activity Stream calculation. The mechanism will not run the calculation for some time after failure. This backoff time increases with every timeout. For reproduction purposes you can turn off this mechanism by adding JVM property to your Jira: {{-Dnavlink.failurecache.initialexpiryMs=0}}.
fields.summary: Activity Stream is timing out when both comments and history entry number for an issue is too high

h2. Suggestion
Since JIRA 7.0, the *Version Workload Report* module has been moved to the *JIRA for Software Plugin*. This essentially means that users who install only JIRA Core are not able to access the *Version Workload Report*.

However, our [Reporting documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/reporting-939937651.html], specific for JIRA Core, provides a description of the purpose of a *Version Workload Report*. This is incorrect as it gives the impression that this feature is still available with JIRA Core.

fields.summary: Do not notify changes of specific custom

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At the moment, Issue Updated event is listened by a WebHook when:
# An issue is updated (Issue Updated) either in Edit Issue screen (clicking the Edit button) or in View Issue screen (inline-update)
# An issue is transitioned (Issue Transitioned)

(+) If a WebHook is configured with a JQL, currently the JQL is checked when:
# For Issue Updated, after the issue is updated
# For Issue Transitioned, when the transition button is clicked, or before the post-functions are executed

(x) This causes some confusion and/or unexpected behaviors, and some requirements can't be achieved.

h3. Scenario / Steps to reproduce
# Create a Select List custom field named Counter with 2 options: One and Two
# Add the field to a Transition screen and all Create/Edit/View Issue screens of project ABC
# Create a WebHook with this configuration:
#* JQL:
{code}project = ABC and Counter = Two{code}
#* Events: *Issue Updated* only
# Create an issue ABC-1 and ensure its Counter value is *not* Two

h3. Scenario 1 - Issue Updated
# Edit the field Counter either inline or in Edit Issue screen for ABC-1 -> Set its value to Two
(/) The WebHook is triggered as expected.
# Edit the field Counter either inline or in Edit Issue screen for ABC-1 -> Set its value to One (or None)
(i) The WebHook is not triggered.

h3. Scenario 2 - Issue Transitioned (the opposite behavior)
# When Counter is not Two, transition ABC-1 and set Counter to Two on the transition screen -> Complete the transition
(-) The WebHook is not triggered as expected.
# When Counter is Two, transition ABC-1 and set Counter to One (or None) on the transition screen -> Complete the transition
(i) The WebHook is triggered.

{panel}
(flag) This makes it impossible to achieve this requirement:
* Fire the WebHook only when ABC-1 is transitioned and its Counter value is set to Two from a different value that doesn't match the WebHook JQL at the time of clicking the transition button.
{panel}

h3. Notes
# This behavior not only applies to a Select List custom field, but also to other fields if they're updated on a Transition screen. Known related issues are:
#* For Status: [JRASERVER-65174 - Webhook is not triggered correctly when the JQL is describing a specific status.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65174]
#* For Status (different JQL): [JRACLOUD-65293 - Transition doesn't trigger webhook if JQL contains 'updated after' with relative time|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65293]
#* For Assignee: [JRASERVER-62919 - Webhook based on JQL would not trigger when used in Workflow Post Functions|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62919]
# This behavior can't be worked around using WebHook Post-function. For example, if the WebHook is added to the post-function list of the Transition, it's not fired either (following Scenario 2), regardless of the order of the post-function.
(on) One may expect that, if the WebHook Post-function is after the Issue Re-index Post-function, the WebHook should be triggered.
fields.summary: WebHook JQL should be checked upon transition completion
Add changes to Resolutions to the Audit log

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Loading wheel is continually shown on custom field setting page.
 This problem can be seen on IE11 and only with Japanese language (or other languages which use multibyte characters) setting.
h3. Environment
 * Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Jira with using IE11
 # Change your language setting to Japanese
 # Navigate to _Jira Administration > Issues > Custom fields_

h3. Expected Results

The page should be shown without any problem.
h3. Actual Results

Loading wheel is continually (not continuously) shown on the page.

!customfield.gif!
h3. Workaround
 # Please use the other browsers to avoid the problem.
 # Use dark feature: {{jira.customfields.paginated.ui.disabled}} to temporarily enable simplified custom fields administration page.
fields.summary: Loading wheel is continually shown on custom field setting page

fields.description:

Current developer documentation [Configuring a JIRA cluster|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/configuring-a-jira-cluster/]

{quote}
Have full clustering enabled, by appending the following setting to the JVM_EXTRA_ARGS variable in the bin/setenv.sh file:
-Datlassian.cluster.scale=true
{quote}
which contains outdated settings. It's not required any more and misleading.
fields.summary: Remove atlassian.cluster.scale from Developer docs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue Collector adds what seems to be a control label to all tickets in the form of *collector-xxxxxxxx* (where xxxx is the collector id) even though the labels fields haven't been used on the collector itself.
h3. Environment
 * Linux (Ubuntu 18.04) & macOS 10.13.6 High Sierra
 * PostgreSQL 9.6
 * Jira Server 7.9.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Creating a new Issue Collector
 # Choose a project
 # Select *Project Settings* on the left side bar
 # Select *Issue collectors*
 # Select *+Add issue collector*
 # Fill in the details and click *Submit*

Creating a sample page
 # At the bottom of the issue collector page copy the sample HTML code to a text editor
 # Copy the issue collector code and insert it in the document's body
 # Save the file as .html
 # Open up in a web browser
 # Create a new issue

 
h3. Actual Results

A new issue is created with a default label in the form of *collector-xxxxxxxx* (see attached screenshot). There is no way to switch off this default behaviour.
h3. Expected Results

It would be useful for admins to switch off the default labelling,

 

Notes

This is not a new bug per say. It is related to [Label injection does not work with Issue Collector 1.0.23-beta|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-issue-collector-plugin/issues/24/label-injection-does-not-work-with-issue]. Just raising it in the appropriate location.
h3. Workaround

So far the only workaround is to remove the *Labels* field from the *Create Issue* screen for the project the issue collector belongs to.
fields.summary: Issue Collector inserts a default and often unwanted label on tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA adds a redundant *atl_token* as a query string to POST requests.
Although this is not a violation to any HTTP standard, but having a redundant parameter fails some Web Application Firewall  (WAF) rules used by customers.
This problem is noticed with transitioning issue, mainly with transitions that have screens associated with them.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core installed, with a workflow that have transition screens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue.
# Transition the issue and check the browser developer tools.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will issue a POST to CommentAssignIssue.jspa with the alt_token part of the form data.

h3. Actual Results
The alt_token is both found in the form data and also as a query string to the POST request.
The token value is the same in both form data and also in the redundant query string.
 !Screenshot_20180827_142139.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
To go around this, a reverse proxy needs to strip the query string from the URL before WAF checks it.
fields.summary: JIRA adds a redundant atl_token as a query string to POST requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When switching the default language to Dutch, some default workflows generated by JIRA don't load from Project Settings > Workflows, although they load properly from ⚙ > Issues > Workflows.

h3. Steps to reproduce

- Go to ⚙ > System > Edit Settings
- Change the language to "Nederlands"
- Save the change
- Create a Core project
- Go to Project Settings > Workflows
- Click on the Default workflow (for example "Project Management Workflow")
- Create a Service Desk project
- Go to Project Settings > Workflows
- Click on the Service Desk Default workflow (for example "JIRA Service Desk default workflow")


h3. Expected behavior:

The workflow should load.

h3. Observed behavior

The page does not load and spins forever. In the console, we can see the following error:
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '1' of null
{code}

 !ExampleOfWorkflowThatDoesntLoad.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 
Open the workflow from ⚙ > Issues > Workflow instead, or switch the default language to English

h3. Note

This issue does not impact all the workflows. For example, some Service Desk workflows automatically created when creating a Service Desk project can be loaded such as "Change Management Workflow for Service Desk":
 !ExampleOfWorkflowsThatLoads.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Some JIRA Default Workflows don't load when the default language is switched to Dutch

When attempting to delete user account via User Management > JIRA will perform search if the user is associated to any users as Reporter/Assignee > Upon clicking the suggested JQL link below error is prompted, due to missing double quote "".

h2. Expected Results
The JQL suggested should include double quote "" when username is an email address, for example:
{code}reporter in ("schew@test.com") ORDER BY priority ASC{code}

h2. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When a user clicks on a link to change the password as the one that's sent when creating a user, the password is not accepted on the second attempt that can happen when there's a particular configuration in the password policy.

h3. How to replicate

# Navigate through Crowd and set a particular Regex for the password
# Connect Jira to Crowd as read/write
# Create a user on Jira side, ensure he/she will be associated to the Crowd directory, and allow the user to set his/her own password (Send notification email)
# When getting the email from the step above, click on the link, and type a new password that won't match the password policy of step 1
# Jira will show a warning as the password does not match the policy in place, so you add a valid password during this second attempt
# The application will display a message describing an error with the token and will provide an option to get a new token

h3. Notes
When "External user management" (General Configuration) is enabled, a different error is triggered that makes impossible to get a new token through the screen:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 2.54.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 

(i) When this particular exception occurs, you have to delete and create the user again. Additionally, you have to ensure the user will add a valid password on the first attempt, otherwise, we'll run into this problem again.
fields.summary: Token seems to get expired when the first attempt to change the password does not match the password policy in place when Jira is connected to Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the issue navigator, using the Z keyboard shortcut enables the user to toggle between the issue List view and the single issue full view. That is, pressing Z will open the full view of the selected issue in the issues list; and clicking Z again will toggle the List view back. This works as expected on the issue List view. However, this does not work on the Detail view as it only toggles to the full view and does not toggle back to the Detail view again.

h3. Suggested Solution
Pressing Z in the Detail view should toggle between the full issue view and the Detail view similar to the List view.

h3. Workaround 

Not available
fields.summary: Z Keyboard shortcut does not toggle correctly in Detail View

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If you are using the same name for both Outward and Inward Description of an issue link type will cause confusion in Jira while sorting the issue link by key. 

{code:none} 
jira.view.issue.links.sort.order = key
{code} 

!Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 8.23.45 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create two new projects (TL1 & ABC). 
# Create one issue in TL1. 
# Create multiple issues in ABC, let's say 10 issues from ABC-1, ABC-2 ... ... to ABC-10. 
# Create a new issue link type at *Administration > Issues > Issue linking (under Issue Features)* named "Test" with the following: 
||Outward Description||Inward Description||
|test out|test in|
 # Link some ABC-# issues to TL-1-1 with "test out" and "test in". 
 # Make sure the sequence is not lined up, else you will not be able to see the difference. Here's an example: 
!Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 9.24.32 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Now change your Outward and Inward Description to the same name, "test". 
 # Go back to TL1-1, and you should be able to see the following: 
!Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 9.14.24 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Expected Results*

The issues linked from both the Outward and Inward Description will be sorted according to their issue key +*together*+ and presented together as one. 

h3. *Actual Results*

The issues linked from both the Outward and Inward Description is not properly sorted. Most likely only the issues linked with the Inward Description is sorted. 

!Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 9.14.24 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Notes*
* The Outward and Inward Description of an issue link type was separated before, but it was changed to the same name later on.
* There are also sometimes when we want to use the same name for both of the descriptions and if this is done from the beginning, it will work as expected where the newly links issues will be considered as one of the descriptions.
* We are not sure if it has taken in the Outward or Inward side of the linkage for sorting, but definitely not both as we are able to see it sorted properly. 
* Though it is most likely the Inward description from our observation. 

h3. *Workaround*

By changing the Outward and Inward Description back to two separate names will resolve the issue. 

!Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 9.24.13 PM.png|thumbnail!

After clicking Edit buttont to edit field value inline, it automatically selects all text, which makes it susceptible to accidental change or deletion of the value, escpecially to new user:

It would be good either to disable this auto-select by default or to provide users option to disable it.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Under a specific test case, the external link in the comment is being removed. See the attached video and steps to reproduce for the detailed test case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a comment with an external link to a previous comment.
# Edit your comment, and prepend it with a text and the picture.
# On save, the external link to the previous comment is removed.

h3. Expected Results

Link stays.

h3. Actual Results

Link evaporates.

h3. Workaround

Have to re-link the comment again after the save.

fields.description: In relation to JRASERVER-17783 and JRASERVER-41269 i would like to have the option, to add default groups and / or admin-groups to a created filter / dashboard, to be able to administrate the filter / dashboard in case of a disabled / removed user.
fields.summary: Adding default groups to shared filters / dashboards

fields.description:
*Issue:* If the markdown for an image attachment contains both defined width/height as well as thumbnail, the thumbnail seems to be stretched and appears blurry within the UI.

*Example 1.) With "thumbnail": |width=362,height=192,thumbnail*
!exampleImage.jpg|width=362,height=192,thumbnail!

*Example 2.) Without "thumbnail": |width=362,height=192*
!exampleImage.jpg|width=362,height=192!

*Notes:* Users can do this manually in text mode, but also Jira will do this if you insert the attachment into the description or a comment and then resize it by clicking and dragging - causing the blurry image due to not removing the thumbnail markdown.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Attach image to the case. Method does not matter.
# Add the attachment to the description or comment.
# In text mode, define the width and height of the image as well as thumbnail OR highlight the image and then click and drag the corners to resize it. (Example 1 above)
# Save the description or comment.
# Observe the blurry image.

*Expected:* Image would appear clear instead of blurry due to including the thumbnail markdown

*Actual:* Image is stretched/blurry.

*Workaround:* Remove thumbnail from markdown in edit mode when manually resizing images. (Example 2 above)
fields.summary: Image attachment blurry when markdown includes both defined width/height as well as thumbnail

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user needs to disable the maximum limit of the number of issues that cab be exported from issues search results. To do so, there is an option called jira.search.views.max.limit under Administration > General configuration which needs to be set to -1 as mentioned in its description. However, a value is -1 in not allowed and an error message "Value must be at least 0" is shown
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Administration > General Configuration
 # Click on Advanced Settings
 # Navigate to jira.search.views.max.limit
 # Try to set the value -1

h3. Expected Results

To be able to set the value to -1 and disable the maximum limit
h3. Actual Results

-1 value is not allowed. The below error message appears
{noformat}
Value must be at least 0
{noformat}
h3. !image-2018-08-23-23-15-08-811.png|width=816,height=159!
h3. Workaround

Set the unlimited group from jira-config.properties to allow only a certain group to have unlimited export results.
 Example configuration:
{code:java}
jira.search.views.default.max=1500
jira.search.views.max.limit=2000
jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group=jira-administrators
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to disable the maximum limit of number of exported issues from GUI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Presently there is no method to manually trigger a directory synchronization outside of the UI. There are several contexts where it would useful to do so (i.e., adding users via script).

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an authenticated REST endpoint that can be called to trigger a sync.
fields.summary: Provide a REST endpoint to trigger directory synchronization
JQL -1w is only 6.5 days in some cases

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira allows users to set an announcement banner at the top of the page. Usually, administrators use that space to notification/alert users about upcoming upgrades, downtimes, unexpected outages.

There are cases when the administrators need to show informational messages (permanent) in all the pages, like a security requirement saying the instance is approved or has confidential data.

h3. Suggested Solution

Usually, the purpose of the two kinds of messages mentioned above (Notification / Informative) doesn't mix well.
It would be good to provide the administrator with an announcement banner positioned at the bottom of the page.

h3. Workaround

Inject JavaScript and CSS (let say to the top banner) to position the message at the bottom. But this solution has limitations and may not render well.
fields.summary: Option to include an anouncement banner at the bottom of the page.

fields.description:
h5. Problem
Under GDPR, you must inform visitors that your website is using cookies, and, if your cookies collect personal data, ask visitors to consent to the data being collected. There's no out-of-the-box configuration for this consent in Jira.

h5. Suggested solution
The feature for cookie consent
fields.summary: Cookie consent in Jira out-of-the-box

fields.description: It would be great if you could create (or modify the existing) custom flag screens.. For example you could add your own option "Flag and add notes" that would allow you to set a flag and add notes.. basically handled like any other screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when "Additional Group DN" is used, JIRA will be adding groups and membership from the group listed the filter.

User would like feature when "Enable Nested Groups" is enabled, then all users found in nested groups should be synchronised in, regardless of the setting of "Additional Group DN".


h3. Suggested Solution

Add option to allow all users found in nested groups to be synchronised in, regardless of the setting of "Additional Group DN" when the nested group is enabled.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Synchronize nested AD groups outside "Additional Group DN" filter

fields.description:
Java 1.8.0_140 and below will return a handshake failure for any browser that doesn't support SNI: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36323704/sni-client-side-mystery-using-java8
Turns out this is a JVM bug: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8144566
That bug was fixed in: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u141-relnotes-3720385.html

Please update the JDK for the Jira Enterprise Release to 1.8.0_141 or above.
fields.summary: Update JDK for Enterprise release to get fix for JDK-8144566: 'Custom HostnameVerifier disables SNI extension'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
h3. Summary
Jira can become unresponsive when too many concurrent "Create Issue" requests happen. 
While the problem is similar to JRASERVER-30528, it has some specific conditions:
 * The threads create new Issue and each would create a transaction as part of {{updateValues}} (and request a connection from the pool), not all would get a connection and some would be waiting.
 ** We will call those that acquired a connection threads 'A' to 'H'. Threads 'I' and 'J' would be waiting.
 * At some point one thread would cause the sequence generator to require new block of sequences
 * The sequence generator would request a new connection from the pool. Assume this is Thread 'A'.
 * Thread 'A' would then require a sequence number calling {{SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.getNextSeqId()}} and need to get a new block of ids would then request a connection from the DB pool to do so
 ** It needs a new connection to do this so it is not in the transaction of the calling thread
 * Thread 'A' is waiting for the connection from the DB pool. DB pool is full.
 * The remaining threads would block at {{SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.getNextSeqId()}}, which is a synchronised method
 * Threads 'B' to 'H" are all now waiting on the synchronization lock of {{SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.getNextSeqId()}} which is held by thread 'A' and so will never release a connection for thread 'A' to use.
 * Jira becomes unresponsive
 ** Afterwards, the threads are in state similar to deadlocks while waiting for connection pool. After a DB pool timeout expires, connections will timeout, opening up new connections to eventually then complete the requests. During this period of time, Jira would be unresponsive.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create many *global* fields with default values
**  Example from local testing: created 50 select fields with default values configured.
 * Initiate a constant stream of concurrent requests creating issues in Jira,  a number of concurrent requests needs to be larger than the maximum DB pool size in {{dbconfig.xml}}.


h3. Expected Results
Jira creates all issues successfully

h3. Actual Results
Jira becomes unresponsive; and in large production instances, may require a restart. Depending on the scenario, Jira may also recover after a period of time.

 * Threads blocked at *getNextSeqId*
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
* Increasing the database pool size (in {{$jira-home/dbconfig.xml}}) can help to alleviate this problem. Increasing the pool size will reduce the impact this bug has (as there will be more connections available for other threads to complete during peak periods).
* Decrease pool timeout value _"<pool-max-wait>5000</pool-max-wait>"_ (in {{$jira-home/dbconfig.xml}})
* (!) When increasing the database pool size in Jira, be sure to take into account the hardware of your database server, the workload it might be performing for other applications, as well as how many connections it can support - for example, MySQL has a maximum of 150 connections + 1 super user; and Postgres typically has a default of 100 connections. Make small, incremental changes, testing and verifying as you go.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Activity Stream gadget is not showing all activities when filtered by user

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an activity steam and filter by username
# Conduct a lot of activity in Jira

h3. Expected Results
All the activity will be displayed in the activity stream 

h3. Actual Results
Some activity is not displayed.
 
h3. Notes
This appears to be similar to JRASERVER-65349, this only happens when there is a lot of activity in a short amount of time.

h3.Workaround
Remove the user filter to see all of the entries.
fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget is not showing all activities when filtered by user

fields.description:
The standard field Description does not appear in the list of fields for Bulk Edit. 

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-829092790.html] does not mention this

Scrolling to the Unavailable Actions does not show Description as a field either.

The workaround is to use the Jira REST API to change the Description in multiple issues.
fields.summary: Allow bulk edit of Description field

fields.description: I will be very useful if we have an option to choose the period/number of days (Say 1 week OR 15 day) for which we want the report. As of now, we can choose the frequency when the scheduler will run but not the time frame of the logs we want to analyse.
fields.summary: Ability to Select Number of Days in the Periodic Scan for Log Analyzer

fields.description: Currently, if the JIRA issue is linked to a page by either the direct link or trackback feature, the page URL is visible on the JIRA issue view page regardless of the Confluence permission settings. This might consider as a security issue for some customer. It will be better to have an option to remove or hide the page URL in case that the current user does not have the page access permission.
fields.summary: Option to hide the no permitted page URL from the JIRA issue view page

fields.description:
When importing from CSV, the import successfully created users, components etc but when it attempted to create issues a Null Pointer Exception was produced.

It turns out it was to do with a custom field which was optional but JIRA considered it to be mandatory and thus failed. 

It would be good if there was a more informative error message than just a Null Pointer Exception when this occurs.
fields.summary: Importing from CSV failed with poor error message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Our add-on Clone Plus for JIRA lets users clone issues across different projects. If the user clicks on cloning an issue then they are presented with a screen where all the possible fields are copied from the original issue.
The problem is when the issue has VersionPicker custom field in the original issue; the values are not selected when the clone screen is displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use cloneIssue method to get the clonedissue object from original issue.
# If the project has changed then get the new version list of the new project - newversionlist
# Based on the values of version picker field in original issue , find the version with same name in newversionlist
# Assign the new version to the clonedissue
# Use FieldScreenRenderLayoutItem#getCreateHtml to generate the required html to be displayed on the screen.

h3. Expected Results
The method should create HTML with original values for the version picker as selected.

h3. Actual Results
The method is generating HTML without any version selected
fields.summary: VersionPicker custom field is not being populated when using FieldScreenRenderLayoutItem#getCreateHtml

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Mantis importer does not import attachments correctly from version 1.2.17

h3. Suggested Solution
Support version 1.2.17 

h3. Workaround 
In Mantis mantis_bug_file_table table, content field contains 0x2727 - It just needs to be set to NULL in order to import correctly.
fields.summary: Mantis importer does not import attachments correctly from version 1.2.17

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When creating an issue the issue will be validated ({{issueService.validateCreate}}).
* Part of this validation checks the issue fields, one of those fields being the Security Level ({{SecurityLevelSystemField.validateParams}}).
* {{SecurityLevelSystemField.validateParams}} only checks that the selected security level exists, not that it is valid for the project the issue is created in.
* {{SecurityLevelSystemField.validateParams}} does not return an error when the security level is not valid for the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
JIRA API:
 # Set up project + one security scheme
 # Create an issue, set security to a valid level in the scheme, no problems
 #* Do this using the JIRA API
 # Change to a different scheme with different levels
 # Create issue using same level as before
#* issue is created and is not accessible to any user (_because of invalid security level_)

JSD Steps:
 # Set up security on the project
 # Change request type to have security level field, hidden, default value is a valid level
 #* Create issue, works fine, security level is correct
 # Change to a different security scheme with different levels
 # Create issue using JSD portal - issue is created but cannot be viewed by anyone because of invalid security level
 #* Note that if you go back to the request type and configure the default value for hidden field - You will be presented with the correct options to choose from. No warning or error. (should show "The security level is invalid.")
 #* If the security level did not exist then there would be an error in the portal and when viewing the default value

h3. Expected Results
Jira will validate _Security Level_ and will return an error ({{SecurityLevelSystemField.validateParams}} returns an error when the security level is not valid for the project).

h3. Actual Results
* An issues being created with an invalid security level.
* These issues are not accessible by any user through the JIRA UI. Database modification is required to fix these issues.

h3. Workaround 
* None. 
* Database modification is required to fix these issues.
fields.summary: SecurityLevelSystemField validateParams does not check issue security level is valid for the project

select count(customfield)
